context: Cheap and good.  Always a winning combination.

I bet the price is not disposable.  There is always an appropriations war between the
Air Force, Army and Navy.  I have seen it up close.  And the Marines get the Navy
left overs.  Even on the carriers.  But one real difference is that the CAG cannot hold
back Marine Squadrons from launching to protect Marines on the ground.  Other
then that the Marines get the last of everything.  Ospreys, Harriers and spent 18s.
But they do one hell of a job with hand me downs and left overs.  Marines come
from the Crucible.  They have done a fairly good job at minimizing the PC culture
that the rest have succumbed to.  A Marine Aviator is a force to be reckoned with.
Only the Marines would build a drone out of duct tape and cardboard...  Hopefully they also used crayon to mark up the tail number.
